stem: The intensive care nurse is managing a client with severe ARDS who is receiving mechanical ventilation. Based on the clinical data in the EHR, match each intervention to its primary physiological purpose in the management of ARDS.

tabs.title: Nurses' Notes
tabs.content:
08:00: Client (45y/o male) with urosepsis has ARDS. Currently intubated on Pressure Control ventilation. 
09:00: SpO2 remains 89% despite 100% FiO2. Chest X-ray show bilateral 'white-out' infiltrates. 
09:30: Provider orders an increase in PEEP and initiates a protocol for prone positioning. 
10:00: Respiratory therapist adjusts tidal volume to 6 mL/kg of predicted body weight to follow 'lung-protective' strategies.

rows.text: Placing the client in the prone position
Utilizing a low tidal volume setting (4â€“6 mL/kg)

columns.text: Recruit collapsed alveoli and prevent atelectasis
Refining V/Q matching and recruiting posterior lung segments
Preventing barotrauma and ventilator-induced lung injury (VILI)
Reducing pulmonary edema and capillary leak

rationale.correct: In ARDS, PEEP (r1) is used specifically to 'pop open' (recruit) alveoli that have collapsed due to fluid and surfactant loss. Prone positioning (r2) shifts the weight of the heart and abdominal contents away from the posterior lung, improving ventilation-perfusion matching. Low tidal volume (r3) is the gold standard for 'lung protection' to prevent over-stretching of the delicate alveoli (barotrauma). A conservative fluid strategy (r4) helps minimize the alveolar-capillary leak which causes the characteristic pulmonary edema of ARDS.
clinicalPearls: PEEP is the 'anchor' for oxygenation in ARDS, but watch for hypotension as high PEEP reduces venous return.
ARDS = Refractory Hypoxemia (low PaO2 despite high FiO2).
Plateau pressure should stay < 30 cm H2O to prevent lung injury.

questionTrap.trap: Thinking that 'High FiO2' is the best way to fix ARDS.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: Remember that oxygen can only reach the blood if the alveoli are OPEN. PEEP and Positioning come first.

mnemonic.title: ARDS Vent
mnemonic.expansion: L-Low tidal volume. P-PEEP high. P-Prone position. C-Conservative fluids.
